content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 6 to node 5 in the provided graph is:

6 -> 7 -> 3 -> 4

Note that the path may include nodes more than once, but it will always follow the same order of edges each time. Also, please note that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point. So if the endpoint is changed to node 5, the shortest path would be:

6 -> 7 -> 2 -> 4

In this case, it's the shortest path that starts from node 6 and goes through nodes 7, 2, and 4 to reach node 5.

The shortest path from node 6 to node 2 in the provided graph is:

6 -> 7 -> 3

Note that the path may include nodes more than once, but it will always follow the same order of edges each time. Also, please note that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point. So if the endpoint is changed to node 2, the shortest path would be:

6 -> 7

In this case, it's the shortest path that starts from node 6 and goes through node 7 to reach node 2.
